project.teaser: SUREWAVE will develop and test an innovative concept of Floating Photo-Voltaic (FPV) system consisting of an external floating breakwater structure acting as a protection against severe wave-wind-current loads on the FPV modules, allowing increased operational availability and...
project.objective: SUREWAVE will develop and test an innovative concept of Floating Photo-Voltaic (FPV) system consisting of an external floating breakwater structure acting as a protection against severe wave-wind-current loads on the FPV modules, allowing increased operational availability and energy output, thus unlocking the massive deployment of Offshore FPV. It will be focused on the research for securing optimal behaviour at aero & hydrodynamic and structural integrity level of the external breakwater, the internal FPV modular structure, the connections, the mooring and anchoring and the whole FPV system, complying with mechanical, electrical (maximizing energy output) and cost-efficiency requirements, ensuring high lifetime of critical components, high reliability of the system and easy, quick and cost-efficient, construction, installation and O&M of the whole system. This will require: 1) the development of novel circular concrete material solutions for the breakwater, cost-effective, easy to produce and with high mechanical, physical and durability properties and low CO2 footprint. 2) the development of an advanced predictive computational modelling and simulation framework: coupled aero & hydrodynamic modelling, Structural integrity modelling, material properties modelling and Structural Health Management to reduce CAPEX and OPEX; 3) the design and implementation of an optimal testing and validation methodology for offshore FPV system to achieve TRL5, including lab testing, basin-model testing and marine environment testing of critical components assuring high resilience to corrosion and biofouling. Maximum advantage of existing expertise will be taken from experts in: offshore wind floating structures, material and phenomena modelling (SINTEF, MARIN, CEIT), design and installation of FPV in calm waters (SIS), floating solutions (CLEMENT), circular structural and non-structural materials (ACC) and in social, environmental and economic assessment (IFEU).
project.title: STRUCTURAL RELIABLE OFFSHORE FLOATING PV SOLUTION INTEGRATING CIRCULAR CONCRETE FLOATING BREAKWATER
project.keywords: Offshore floating Photovoltaic, FPV, aerodynamic, hydrodynamic, wave-breaker, new circular concrete materials, anchoring, mooring, modeling and simulation tools, structural health management

article.title: Developing a novel floating photovoltaic system

result.title: SMART CORROSION MONITORING BASED ON NON DESTRUCTIVE TESTINGS (NDTs)

details.authors: Upeksha Chathurani Thibbotuwa, Ainhoa Cortés, Andoni Irizar

result.title: Dissemination, Exploitation & Communication Master Plan (M18 revision)
result.description: This deliverable includes the strategy based in communication measures and targeted audiences, but also dissemination and exploitation routes. Associated to Task 8.2

result.title: Report on environmental assessment
result.description: Analysis of all relevant potential environmental impacts including LCA. Conclusions and recommendations are provided. Associated to Task 7.3

result.title: Dissemination, Exploitation & Communication Master Plan
result.description: This deliverable includes the strategy based in communication measures and targeted audiences, but also dissemination and exploitation routes. To be revised on M18. Associated to Task 8.2

result.title: Anchoring and connections to PV system
result.description: The report for this task includes a summary of analysis results indicating advantages and disadvantages for different design options of the anchoring types and the connections between the floating breakwater and the FPV array. Based on the technical requirements from D2.2, the fulfillment of these criteria for material properties, anchoring type, cost-effectiveness, compatibility with the arrangement of power distribution cables, and functionality of the connections to the FPV array is evaluated. Associated to tasks 3.3 and 3.4.

details.authors: Joep van der Zanden ,Tim Bunnik ,Ainhoa Cortés ,Virgile Delhaye ,Guillaume Kegelart ,Thomas Pehlke and Balram Panjwani

result.title: Breakwater prototype
result.description: Proof of the breakwater developed with a reduced scale of 1m (wide), 0.5 (heigh) , 2m (length). Associated to task 4.4

result.title: Report on ultimate strength capacity of each connection
result.description: In this report, the ultimate strength of the criticalComponents (i.e. Mechanical joint and connection systems) of the floating PV system defined in WP3, to check the survivability during extreme scenarios (Storm conditions) will be reported. Associated to Task 6.2

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SUREWAVE (STRUCTURAL RELIABLE OFFSHORE FLOATING PV SOLUTION INTEGRATING CIRCULAR CONCRETE FLOATING BREAKWATER)
result.teaser: Context: The European Offshore Renewable Energy Strategy emphasizes the need to advance established renewable energy technologies and diversify the technology portfolio to fully harness the vast potential of EU seas, aiming for climate neutrality by 2050. The maturity levels...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Summary of global system design
result.description: Delivered as holistic design documentation for full FPV solution, based on metocean conditions and full system design. Associated with tasks 3.1, 3.2, 3.3, and particularly 2.1-3.4

result.title: Report on social assessment
result.description: Analysis of social sustainability aspects. Conclusions and recommendations are provided. Associated to task 7.5

result.title: Design description of internal floating PV components
result.description: Delivered as design documentation for adaptation of floating solar panels for extreme conditions, integrated with novel wave breaker technology. Associated with tasks 3.1, 3.4 and to limited extent 3.2 and 3.3

result.title: Establishing a technical stakeholders advisory board
result.description: The deliverable is signed intentions of relevant stakeholders participating in the SHB. Associated with task 2.4

result.title: Use case scenario basis for typical, rough location
result.description: In this report, several offshore locations with extreme environmental conditions will be identified and possibility of corrosion and biofouling will be analysed. The worst-case scenarios for a 20 years return period, in accordance with DNV RP 0584 will also be defined. Associated to Task 2.1.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
